You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Autoplay Show Thumbnails Show Captions Last Slide Next Slide Madonna’s concert at Joe Louis Arena on Thursday was a celebration of creativity, her hometown and, most of all, herself.
The Michigan superstar’s Rebel Heart tour stop saw the Material Girl focusing heavily on her latest album, this year’s “Rebel Heart,” while also shuffling through a hearty sampling of second-tier hits from her 30-plus year catalog. There was no “Ray of Light,” “Like a Prayer” or “Express Yourself,” but instead she turned in refurbished versions of “True Blue,” “Dress You Up,” “Frozen” and “Who’s That Girl.” Madonna has always had fun playing with her catalog, and “Like a Virgin” has been remixed all sorts of ways over the years, but on Thursday it was presented as a mid-’00s hip-hop jam (think Ciara’s “Goodies”).

Madonna received plenty of blow back earlier this year for some unflattering remarks she made about her home state, but on Thursday she was full of nothing but love for Detroit and Michigan. “Motor City, are you ready to party?” she asked early on. “The hometown girl is back!”
She later shouted out her father and her daughter, who were in the crowd, along with students from Detroit’s Downtown Boxing Gym. She also had kind words for Dan Gilbert and said she was proud to be part of Detroit’s revival.
“Detroit is making a comeback, so watch out!” she said. “I said watch out! Get excited, come on!”
